title: 104_hr1024
content: The text chunk discusses amendments to various sections of different titles in the United States Code, replacing references to the "Joint Committee on Printing" with other committees or entities such as the "Committee on Rules and Administration of the House of Representatives" and the "Public Printer". Amendments are made to various sections of different titles in the United States Code, replacing references to the "Joint Committee on Printing" with the "Public Printer" and other committees or entities. The Administrative Services Act of 1949 is amended to renumber paragraphs and make changes to Title 44 of the United States Code, including replacing references to the "Joint Committee on Printing" with the "Public Printer" and updating appeal procedures. The Administrative Services Act of 1949 amends Title 44 of the United States Code by replacing references to the "Joint Committee on Printing" with the "Public Printer" and updating appeal procedures under subchapter III of chapter 71 of title 5. The Administrative Services Act of 1949 updates Title 44 of the United States Code by replacing references to the "Joint Committee on Printing" with the "Public Printer" and adjusting various sections accordingly. The Administrative Services Act of 1949 amends Title 44 of the United States Code by replacing references to the "Joint Committee on Printing" with the "Public Printer" in various sections. The Administrative Services Act of 1949 amends Title 44 of the United States Code by replacing references to the "Joint Committee on Printing" with the "Public Printer" in various sections, including sections 512 and 513. Section 514 of Title 44, United States Code is amended to replace the determination by the Joint Committee on Printing with the application of provisions by the Public Printer. The decision of the Committee is no longer final. Section 515 is also amended to remove reporting defaults to the Joint Committee on Printing. Section 515 of title 44, United States Code is amended to remove reporting defaults to the Joint Committee on Printing. Section 517 is amended to authorize the Public Printer instead of the Joint Committee on Printing. Section 702 is amended to replace "Joint Committee on Printing" with "Public Printer". Section 703 is amended to replace "Joint Committee on Printing" with "Committee on Rules and Administration of the Senate". Section 707 of title 44, United States Code is amended to authorize the Public Printer, in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives, to print bills or resolutions in the style and form deemed most suitable. The Public Printer, in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives, may print bills or resolutions in a style deemed most suitable for efficiency and economy until final enactment in Congress. Additionally, amendments are made to sections 709 and 714 of title 44, United States Code, regarding the role of the Public Printer in printing processes. The Public Printer, in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives, will establish rules for printing processes. Sections 717 and 718 of title 44, United States Code, are amended to reflect this change. Section 718 of title 44, United States Code is amended to replace the "Joint Committee on Printing" with the "Public Printer, in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives." Section 721(a) is also amended to reflect this change, along with sections 722 and 723. Section 722, 723, and 724 of title 44, United States Code are amended to replace references to the "Joint Committee on Printing" with the "Public Printer" in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives. Section 724, 728, 738, and 901 of title 44, United States Code are amended to replace references to the "Joint Committee on Printing" with the "Public Printer" in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives. Section 901, 902, and 903 of title 44, United States Code are amended to replace references to the "Joint Committee on Printing" with the "Public Printer" in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives. Section 906 of title 44, United States Code is amended to send copies to the Committee on Rules and Administration of the Senate and the Committee on House Oversight of the House of Representatives. Section 906 of title 44, United States Code is amended to send copies to the Committee on Rules and Administration of the Senate and the Committee on House Oversight of the House of Representatives, as designated by the respective committees. Section 906 of title 44, United States Code is amended to send copies to the Committee on Rules and Administration of the Senate and the Committee on House Oversight of the House of Representatives, with specific instructions on formatting and distribution. Section 1108, 1112, 1121, and 1301 of title 44, United States Code are amended to remove references to the Joint Committee on Printing and replace them with the Public Printer. This change gives the Public Printer more authority over the printing process. Section 1121, 1301, 1320A, 1333, and 1338 of title 44, United States Code are amended to remove references to the Joint Committee on Printing and give more authority to the Public Printer. Section 1338 of title 44, United States Code is amended to remove limitations and conditions prescribed by the Joint Committee on Printing and give more authority to the Public Printer. Section 1705 is also amended to remove regulation by the Joint Committee on Printing. Section 1710 is amended to remove references to a plan. Section 1705, 1710, and 1914 of title 44, United States Code are amended to remove references to the Joint Committee on Printing. Section 5(b) of the Federal Records Management Amendments of 1976 is also amended to eliminate the Joint Committee on Printing's involvement. The Act and its amendments will take effect on the first day of the 9th month after enactment.
